texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Nigeria's Fiber of Excellence; Sustainably Grown for Textile Brilliance
texts.text: Nigeria's Fiber of Excellence; Sustainably Grown for Textile Brilliance

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Cotton was one of the main sources of foreign exchange in Nigeria prior to oil boom. Nigeria produces about 600,000 metric tons of cotton with production concentrating around the Savannah belts of Nigeria. The cotton-producing areas in Nigeria are the Northwest cotton zone which comprises, Katsina; Jigawa; Sokoto; Kebbi and Zamfara States which comprises of Adamawa; Taraba; Yobe, Maiduguri, Bauchi and Gombe States and produces 30 to 35% of cotton in Nigeria_ The annual business revenue stimulated by cotton in Nigerian economy has an excess of one hundred billion naira and contributed over one million jobs_ This makes cotton one of the major valueadded crops in Nigeria
texts.text: Cotton was one of the main sources of foreign exchange in Nigeria prior to oil boom. Nigeria produces about 600,000 metric tons of cotton with production concentrating around the Savannah belts of Nigeria. The cotton-producing areas in Nigeria are the Northwest cotton zone which comprises, Katsina; Jigawa; Sokoto; Kebbi and Zamfara States which comprises of Adamawa; Taraba; Yobe, Maiduguri, Bauchi and Gombe States and produces 30 to 35% of cotton in Nigeria_ The annual business revenue stimulated by cotton in Nigerian economy has an excess of one hundred billion naira and contributed over one million jobs_ This makes cotton one of the major valueadded crops in Nigeria

texts.orig: INDO RAMA For more information; fertsales@ng indorama.com +2349139364345
texts.text: INDO RAMA For more information; fertsales@ng indorama.com +2349139364345

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Cotton is adapted to a wide range of soil types (sandy loam to clay loam) but prefers well-drained fertile soil with pH between 6.0 - 6.5.
texts.text: Cotton is adapted to a wide range of soil types (sandy loam to clay loam) but prefers well-drained fertile soil with pH between 6.0 - 6.5.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The land selected should be void of debris or stubbles from previous crops
texts.text: The land selected should be void of debris or stubbles from previous crops

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The land should be ploughed and harrowed into a fine tilth.
texts.text: The land should be ploughed and harrowed into a fine tilth.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Ridging is done at the spacing of 75 cm.
texts.text: Ridging is done at the spacing of 75 cm.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Where the land is sloppy; ridge across the slope to prevent erosion.
texts.text: Where the land is sloppy; ridge across the slope to prevent erosion.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Pre-planting herbicide (Glyphosate) at the rate of 2L/Ha should be sprayed two weeks to planting.
texts.text: Pre-planting herbicide (Glyphosate) at the rate of 2L/Ha should be sprayed two weeks to planting.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Seed Rate and Time of Sowing
texts.text: Seed Rate and Time of Sowing

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Obtain seed from reputable licensed seed companies or research institutes_
texts.text: Obtain seed from reputable licensed seed companies or research institutes_

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The seed rate of 15 kglha is recommended.
texts.text: The seed rate of 15 kglha is recommended.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Seed should be treated using a seed dressing chemical (such as 20 % Metalayxl 20 % Imidacloprid at rate of 10 g per 4 kg of the seeds) . the
texts.text: Seed should be treated using a seed dressing chemical (such as 20 % Metalayxl 20 % Imidacloprid at rate of 10 g per 4 kg of the seeds) . the

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Seeds are sown at the rate of 5 seeds per hole at a depth of about 3-5cm then thinned to 2 plants per hole at 3 weeks after planting.
texts.text: Seeds are sown at the rate of 5 seeds per hole at a depth of about 3-5cm then thinned to 2 plants per hole at 3 weeks after planting.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Plants should be 45 cm apart on the ridge
texts.text: Plants should be 45 cm apart on the ridge

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Timely sowing reduces the incidence of insects and diseases
texts.text: Timely sowing reduces the incidence of insects and diseases

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Late sowing as practiced by most cotton farmers may result to reduced cotton yield by about 46%-
texts.text: Late sowing as practiced by most cotton farmers may result to reduced cotton yield by about 46%-

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: All missing stands should be reseeded week after sowing.
texts.text: All missing stands should be reseeded week after sowing.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Fertilizer Management with 4R Nutrient Stewardship nutrient
texts.text: Fertilizer Management with 4R Nutrient Stewardship nutrient

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Where available and for good mineralization stewardship
texts.text: Where available and for good mineralization stewardship

texts.label: text
texts.orig: of organic manure, it should be incorporated
texts.text: of organic manure, it should be incorporated

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: into the soil at least 2 weeks before sowing at the rate of 8-10 tonslha
texts.text: into the soil at least 2 weeks before sowing at the rate of 8-10 tonslha

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Apply fertilizer at the rate of 100 kg Nitrogen: 40 kg Phosphorus: 40 kg Potassium /Ha
texts.text: Apply fertilizer at the rate of 100 kg Nitrogen: 40 kg Phosphorus: 40 kg Potassium /Ha

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8 number of 50 kg bags (4OOkg) of Indorama NPK is required for hectare of cotton which will supply the full dose of Phosphorus and Potassium
texts.text: 8 number of 50 kg bags (4OOkg) of Indorama NPK is required for hectare of cotton which will supply the full dose of Phosphorus and Potassium

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The balance of Nitrogen is supplied 2 numbers 50 kg bags (100 kgs) Indorama neem coated urea in split applications using
texts.text: The balance of Nitrogen is supplied 2 numbers 50 kg bags (100 kgs) Indorama neem coated urea in split applications using

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The first split dose of Neem coated Urea is applied at 3-4 weeks after basal application and the remaining half applied at 6-8 weeks
texts.text: The first split dose of Neem coated Urea is applied at 3-4 weeks after basal application and the remaining half applied at 6-8 weeks

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Apply the urea fertilizer 10 cm away from crop using side placement method. the
texts.text: Apply the urea fertilizer 10 cm away from crop using side placement method. the

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Indorama Fertilizer: Improving Agriculture, Improving Lives
texts.text: Indorama Fertilizer: Improving Agriculture, Improving Lives

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Apply Nitrogen fertilizer early in the morning or evening
texts.text: Apply Nitrogen fertilizer early in the morning or evening

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Avoid Nitrogen fertilizer application when it is about to rain or when the weather is cloudy
texts.text: Avoid Nitrogen fertilizer application when it is about to rain or when the weather is cloudy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Do not apply Nitrogen fertilizer at once but in split doses to minimize losses.
texts.text: Do not apply Nitrogen fertilizer at once but in split doses to minimize losses.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Avoid broadcast method of fertilizer application:
texts.text: Avoid broadcast method of fertilizer application:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Apply nitrogen fertilizer after weeding to prevent competition from weeds
texts.text: Apply nitrogen fertilizer after weeding to prevent competition from weeds

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Apply only the recommended dose of Nitrogen fertilizer
texts.text: Apply only the recommended dose of Nitrogen fertilizer

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Proper drainage will reduce Nitrogen loss due to runoff.
texts.text: Proper drainage will reduce Nitrogen loss due to runoff.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Hoe weeding should be carefully carried out at 4 and 8 weeks after sowing.
texts.text: Hoe weeding should be carefully carried out at 4 and 8 weeks after sowing.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: For pre-emergence herbicide; Apply 2 L/ha Diuron 80% WP 3 days after sowing.
texts.text: For pre-emergence herbicide; Apply 2 L/ha Diuron 80% WP 3 days after sowing.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Post-emergence herbicide; apply Fulsilate forte at rate of 1.5 Llha at 5 weeks after planting depending on the intensity of weeds
texts.text: Post-emergence herbicide; apply Fulsilate forte at rate of 1.5 Llha at 5 weeks after planting depending on the intensity of weeds

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Harvesting is done when there are reasonable number of split bolls (50%).
texts.text: Harvesting is done when there are reasonable number of split bolls (50%).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Seed cotton is to be picked 2 or more times starting with the clean ones first during the cooler part of the day.
texts.text: Seed cotton is to be picked 2 or more times starting with the clean ones first during the cooler part of the day.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Picking should be done at regular intervals to prevent rain damage and staining which can also lower seed cotton grade
texts.text: Picking should be done at regular intervals to prevent rain damage and staining which can also lower seed cotton grade

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Timely picking is advised to avoid falling of seed cotton on the ground which leads to deterioration of quality .
texts.text: Timely picking is advised to avoid falling of seed cotton on the ground which leads to deterioration of quality .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Picked seed-cotton should be kept well to avoid contamination with dirt and other foreign matters such as dry leaf trash.
texts.text: Picked seed-cotton should be kept well to avoid contamination with dirt and other foreign matters such as dry leaf trash.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Sort out the inferior from good quality seed cotton_
texts.text: Sort out the inferior from good quality seed cotton_

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Clean storage areas thoroughly before picking and storing produce.
texts.text: Clean storage areas thoroughly before picking and storing produce.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Picked seed-cotton should be stored in a well-ventilated, cool, shady and clean store or sterilized jute bags.
texts.text: Picked seed-cotton should be stored in a well-ventilated, cool, shady and clean store or sterilized jute bags.

Indorama NPK maintains quality and have a perfect balance of INDORAMA nitrogen, phosphorus_ and potassium. Nitrogen is needed for vegetative growth. Phosphorus is needed to produce strong roots and shoots- Potassium is needed to produce quality fruit and flowers also increases resistance to diseases.
